Course Description: rendering, geometric modelling, display optics, sensors and tracking, vestibular systems and interface design. Advanced areas of VR including telepresence, procedural modelling of large virtual worlds, and designing multi-model interactions and interfaces for VR will also be discussed. This will be a project-based course using game engine based VR development.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Apply the learned concepts to design moderate to large VR based systems
Course Outcomes.CO2: Understand rendering in VR and challenges
Course Outcomes.CO3: Be able to use geometric modelling algorithms to design virtual worlds
Course Outcomes.CO4: Be able to design user interactions in VR

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Graphics pipeline, Real-time rendering in VR
Light and optics, lens systems and imaging, lens aberrations
Human perception: visual, audio, vestibular, and tactile
Procedural modelling and creation of large virtual worlds
User interfaces, social interaction and evaluation of VR systems

Resource Material.Reference Book: Doug A. Bowman, Ernst Kruijff, Joseph J. LaViola, and Ivan Poupyrev, 3D User Interfaces, Addison-Wesley, 2005.
